1:
Better is a poor person who walks in his integrity
\q than one who is perverse in speech and is a fool.
\q
2:
Also, it is not good to have desire without knowledge
\q and the one who runs too fast misses the path.
3:
A person's folly ruins his life
\q and his heart rages against Yahweh.
\q
4:
Wealth adds many friends,
\q but a poor person is separated from his friends.
5:
A false witness will not go unpunished
\q and he who breathes out lies will not escape.
\q
6:
Many will ask for a favor from a generous person
\q and everyone is a friend of the one who gives gifts.
7:
All the brothers of a poor man hate him;
\q how much more do his friends who go far away from him!
\q He calls out to them, but they are gone.
\q
8:
He who gets wisdom loves his own life;
\q he who keeps understanding will find what is good.
9:
A false witness will not go unpunished,
\q but the one who breathes out lies will perish.
\q
10:
It is not fitting for a fool to live in luxuryâ€”
\q much less for a slave to rule over princes.
11:
Discretion makes a person slow to anger
\q and it is his glory to overlook an offense.
\q
12:
The wrath of the king is like the roaring of a young lion,
\q but his favor is like dew on the grass.
13:
A foolish son is ruin to his father
\q and a quarreling wife is a constant dripping of water.
\q
14:
A house and wealth are inherited from parents,
\q but a prudent wife is from Yahweh.
15:
Laziness throws a person into a deep sleep,
\q but the one not willing to work will go hungry.
\q
16:
The one who obeys the command guards his life,
\q but the person who does not think about his ways will die.
17:
Whoever is kind to the poor lends to Yahweh
\q and he will repay him for what he has done.
\q
18:
Discipline your son while there is hope
\q and do not set your desire on putting him to death.
20:
Listen to advice and accept instruction,
\q so you may become wise by the end of your life.
21:
Many are the plans in a person's heart,
\q but it is the purpose of Yahweh that will stand.
\q
22:
Loyalty is what a person desires
\q and a poor person is better than a liar.
23:
Honor for Yahweh leads people to life;
\q anyone who has it will be satisfied
\q and not afflicted by harm.
\q
24:
The sluggard buries his hand in the dish;
\q he will not even bring it back up to his mouth.
25:
Strike a mocker, and the naive person will become prudent;
\q discipline one who is discerning, and he will gain knowledge.
26:
The one who robs his father and chases his mother away
\q is a son who brings shame and reproach.
\q
27:
If you cease to hear instruction, my son,
\q you will stray from the words of knowledge.
28:
A corrupt witness mocks justice
\q and the mouth of the wicked swallows iniquity.
\q
29:
Condemnation is ready for mockers
\q and flogging for the backs of fools.
